title: Equal Pay for Equal Work
description: Ensures that women and men are paid equally for the same job.
explanation: If you’re doing the same work as a male colleague, you must be paid the same salary. It’s illegal for employers to pay women less just because of their gender.

title: Paid Leave for Mothers
description: Provides paid leave for pregnant women.
explanation: If you’re pregnant, you’re entitled to paid leave before and after childbirth. This law ensures you can take care of your baby without losing your job or income.

title: Safety from Domestic Abuse
description: Protects women from physical, emotional, and economic abuse at home.
explanation: If you’re facing violence or abuse from your husband or family, you can seek legal protection. The court can order the abuser to stay away from you and provide financial support.

title: Safe Workplace for Women
description: Protects women from sexual harassment at work.
explanation: If anyone at your workplace harasses you (e.g., inappropriate comments or advances), you can file a complaint. Your employer must take action to ensure your safety.

title: No Dowry Allowed
description: Makes giving or taking dowry illegal.
explanation: Demanding or accepting dowry (money or gifts) during marriage is a crime. If you’re pressured for dowry, you can report it to the police.

title: Free Education for Girls
description: Ensures free and compulsory education for girls up to age 14.
explanation: Every girl has the right to go to school and get an education. No one can stop you from studying.

title: Equal Property Rights
description: Gives daughters equal rights to inherit family property.
explanation: As a daughter, you have the same right as your brothers to inherit your parents’ property. No one can deny you your share.
